"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e6cb0c6368727bb9660000#post_53e6cb0c6368727bb9660000
[bq="Evident Disaster"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e6c9296368725f703b0000#post_53e6c9296368725f703b0000

I was making a reference. 
And also I'm just curious. I really haven't read FOE in a very long time now, I finished the original, but did anyone actually ask what happen with all the stuff in S3 and late S2? [/bq]
Short version FOE is no longer in line with canon and there's two camps of the FOE community with this:
1)The people that understand it's merely fanon and you shouldn't get worked up about it.
2)The trainwrecks that were shipping rocket fuel and have since become a burning pile of junk.

topics.body:
Speaking of the show; I may no longer be a brony and call me names or such, but personally I don't think the show is going to last longer than 7 seasons.  The reason why is excluding the season premieres and finales the viewership is starting to flounder.

It's still a popular show, but in your average tv show lifetime it's in that part where you're going "Eeyup; that show not going to get another five seasons".

Viewership peaked during season 3, now it's on par of popularity as season two right now.

Luka from monster girl quest.

Speaking of which some of the new stuff about the sequel came out; basically they're adding in a actual combat system where you can recruit monster girls.  Basically fire emblem with a monster capture system.  You can recruit any monster girl, but you can only have 7 on your team at a time and three in battle.

"Monster girl quest: Paradox. Gotta fuck them all!"

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e6d0de63687267296d0000#post_53e6d0de63687267296d0000
This game sounds... interesting.

As for FiM's lifespan. Even when this is over. Hasbro *will* find ways to keep the franchise going. They could make a new generation. But they could also use FiM and G4 design's reputation to build on, without wasting too much effort and risking another G3 scale flop on trying to make something completely new. Due to G4's success, I can totally see them try to use whatever Faust and the DHX team provided them with as a reference.

Maybe they could extend G4's life by making a sequel to the current FiM series. Same world, same mechanics, and same designs. Just different place and characters.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e6d361636872243fc00000#post_53e6d361636872243fc00000
The problem with that though is that a lot of toy companies came out to have a good time and are feel like they're getting shafted financially right now.

What I mean by this is that the only thing holding up Hasbro's stocks right now is MLP.  Other toy makers are subsidiaries of other larger companies; like how disney owns several toy companies; whereas companies like Toys-R-Us and such had to have their stocks pulled.

What is probably going to happen in the long run is that Hasbro is going to have the same thing happen to them in the long run; their stocks will diminish due to people just don't buy as many toys nowadays and then they're going to get bought out and be pulled from the stock market.


Obviously another generation to MLP will probably come about eventually but if you're expecting it to just get popped out right after FIM you're barking up the wrong tree.  More realistically we're talking at least a five year interval between FIM and whatever comes after it.
